title.narrative: WATER, SANITATION AND HYGIENE

description.narrative: Emergency response in the Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) area, which contributes to Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: New Element

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Emergency response in the WASH area

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to provide leadership on the WASH response to the COVID-19 pandemic (through the national WASH cluster platform) and on the Venezuelan migration response (a focal point for WASH in the national UNHCR OIM-led R4V coordination platform). UNICEF has also provided essential services to mitigate the impact of both crises, supporting access to WASH services in schools to support a return to face-to-face education. This work has principally focused on rural areas but also on larger peri-urban schools where numbers of students have increased significantly due to migrant and refugee arrivals. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/01/2022
